metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12825 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
libcroco through 0.6.13 has excessive recursion in cr_parser_parse_any_core in cr-parser.c, leading to stack consumption.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12825` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gnome-shell - 42.9-0ubuntu2
gnome-shell-common - 42.9-0ubuntu2
gnome-shell-extension-prefs - 42.9-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: gnome-shell package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '42.9-0ubuntu2').
